title: Baked Peppers with Tomatoes
introduction: Baked Peppers with Tomatoes is a flavorful dish that combines the sweetness of bell peppers with the heat of a fresh chili and the richness of garlic-infused tomatoes. Originally hailing from Abruzzo, this versatile and vibrant recipe can also be enjoyed as a delicious filling for sandwiches.
ingredients: 1 chile, such as jalapeño, seeded and chopped
2 medium tomatoes, peeled, seeded, and chopped
instructions: Place a rack in the center of the oven. Preheat the oven to 400°F. Oil a large baking pan. Stand the peppers on a cutting board. Holding the stem in one hand, place the cutting edge of a large heavy chef's knife just beyond the edge of the cap. Cut straight down. Turn the pepper 90° and cut straight down again. Repeat, turning and cutting the remaining two sides. Discard the core, seeds, and stem, which will be in one piece. Cut away any membranes and scrape out any seeds.
Cut the peppers lengthwise into 1-inch strips. Add the chile to the pan. Add the oil and salt to taste and toss well. Spread the peppers out in the pan.
Bake the peppers for 25 minutes. Add the garlic and tomatoes and stir well. Bake for 20 minutes more or until the peppers are tender when pierced with a knife. Serve hot.
